Phillip Lopate's essay on the revised AIA Guide to New York City (''New York Brick by Brick,'' June 18), cites a reference in the guide to a ferry that ran in the 20's and 30's between College Point, Queens, and the Clason Point Amusement Park in the Bronx. He goes on to quote: ''A freak wind squall'' blew down the Ferris wheel, killing 24 and dooming the resort. He then reflects: ''An entire resort about which I knew nothing, and now I cannot get that freak wind squall out of my mind.''

Neither can I. My maternal grandmother used to speak of a brother who died in a Ferris wheel accident. My mother grew up in College Point, Queens. Can this great-uncle of mine have taken the ferry to Clason Point that day and ridden the ill-fated Ferris wheel? Mr. Lopate's article will stay with me for a while.
SUSAN J. BEHRENS Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn
